Pioli was unable to name either Ante Rebic nor Rafael Leao in his squad list for the return leg – as well as Alessio Romagnoli and Davide Calabria – and they will therefore not be available for tonight’s match against United. However, the centre-forward will not even be Zlatan Ibrahimovic, who as Pioli explained yesterday at the press conference does not have 90 minutes in his legs.


Samu Castillejo will play at the centre of the Milan attack and will act as a false 9, where Brahim Diaz has played before. There is a significant update regarding the defensive department as Diogo Dalot will not play as the right-back, but instead Pierre Kalulu.

In Milan’s victory against Fiorentina yesterday, Bennacer’s presence was fundamental. The Algerian immediately entered the heart of the game and, after entering the field in place of Tonali, led the team to victory.

According to Calciomercato.com, Milan would have agreed with the Algerian national team to let them play only one match, so as not to risk tiring him. Bennacer has a contract with Milan until June 2024, but a 50 million euro clause will be activated this summer. There are no concrete offers for now, but Maldini, as anticipated by Calciomercato.com, will speak with the player’s entourage to avoid nasty surprises.
